abstract: Warren E. Buffett criticized the trading culture of Wall Street. | A venture capitalist is betting he will find the next Mark Zuckerberg in China. | The S.E.C. charged the Chinese affiliates of five big accounting firms with violating securities laws. | Hollywood films about the evils of capitalism are often financed with tax incentives.
snippet: Warren E. Buffett criticized the trading culture of Wall Street. | A venture capitalist is betting he will find the next Mark Zuckerberg in China. | The S.E.C. charged the Chinese affiliates of five big accounting firms with violating securities l...
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett, the Berkshire Hathaway chief, criticized the trading culture of Wall Street, which he says offers incentives to generate fees and fast profits. Over lunch with Andrew Ross Sorkin, he said he was skeptical of the modern-day hedge fund industry and added that his preferred strategy was still to buy and hold, Mr. Sorkin writes in the DealBook column.

headline.main: Buffett on the State of Wall Street
